content: crochet a cozy winter cowl with ties or leave them off this pattern has lots of options to fit your unique style find the matching slouch hat over here 1 ***this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience *** **difficulty ** easy/intermediate *techniques used working in the 3rd loop of a half-double_crochet cluster stitches post stitches center single_crochet creating i cord* **materials needed ** 5 h mm hook or hook needed to obtain gauge cowl body 4 5mm hook ribbed band 425 460 495 530 565 yards #4 red heart soft in seafoam or the color of your choice yarn needle scissors stitch markers optional 1/8 yard faux fur for pom-poms at end of ties **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet **additional terms ** working in the 3rd loop of half_double_crochet look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back and you should see another v you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop 2dc cluster yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 1st stitch of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 2nd st of cluster made yo draw through all loops on hook 3dc cluster = yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 1st stitch of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 2nd st of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 3rd st of cluster made yo draw through all loops on hook st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces skip = skip prev = previous **gauge ** approximately 14 half_double_crochet in 4 **measurements ** these measurements are taken with the cowl laying flat the circumference will be double what the flat measurement is for example a 13 wide cowl will be 26 in circumference x-small/small 12 wide by 12 1/2 tall small/medium 13 wide by 12 1/2 tall medium/large 14 wide by 12 1/2 tall large-x large 15 wide by 12 1/2 tall 2x-3x-large 16 wide by 12 1/2 tall **additional notes ** -chain-1 at beginning of round does not count as a stitch -the body of this pattern is worked in multiples of 2 see pattern for additional notes 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/serendipity-slouch-hat
